title: Writing MarkLogic Apps on REST APIs
abstract: This technical talk explains how MarkLogic has been developing a set of REST endpoints to store, retrieve, query, and analyze XML and JSON documents held inside MarkLogic Server. The REST endpoints expose the vast majority of MarkLogic's most popular indexes and features, but in a way that you as the developer can author your app in the language of your choosing.  We'll talk first about the Corona project: a community-sponsored, open-source, RESTful interface library available today. Then we'll give a preview of what's being developed for a future MarkLogic release.

surveys.comments: I'm really excited about the REST interface and Jason and Colleen did a great job explaining it. One of the best sessions so far.
